arts.ttl: Supercomputer predicts Premier League title race after Rodri's season-ending injury
arts.sum: A massive blow to Man City's hopes of claiming a fifth successive Premier League crown in what could be Pep Guardiola's final season at the helm, the fabled Opta supercomputer has examined the title race in closer detail following the Euro 2024 winner's injury. Opta only offer five sides a chance of winning the Premier League title and even then the stat experts have shown little faith in unlikely candidates Newcastle United and Chelsea .

arts.ttl: 'I would say': Jamie Carragher gives Arsenal's percentage chance of winning the PL after Rodri's injury
Thursday's Transfer Talk Update: Rodri, Wojciech Szczesny, Rodrygo
arts.sum: Sports Mole rounds up the latest confirmed transfer news and speculation from across the footballing world.

arts.ttl: Transfer Talk: AC Milan eye USMNT star Johnny Cardoso
arts.sum: - Chelsea have added Bayer Leverkusen's Victor Boniface to the list of options being considered as they aim to sign a striker in the summer, claims TEAMtalk . - Werder Bremen are hoping to force Naby Keïta out of the club in January, reports Sport Bild, after the midfielder's proposed summer move to Hatayspor fell through at the last minute because the 29-year-old decided that he didn't want to go to Turkey.

arts.ttl: Rodri injury: Five players Man City could look to sign in January to replace Spaniard
arts.sum: Sports Mole takes a look at five players who Man City could look to sign in the January transfer window to replace injured midfielder Rodri.

arts.ttl: Man City dealt blow in title race as Rodri injury confirmed
arts.sum: Man City have been dealt a major blow in the Premier League title race after tests confirmed the injury sustained by Rodri. The Spanish midfielder’s knee seemingly buckled during last weekend’s 2-2 draw with Arsenal, leaving him in agony on the Emirates Stadium pitch before hobbling off. Following reports of a potentially season-ending injury, Pep […] The post Man City dealt blow in title race as Rodri injury confirmed first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: “It’s very close” – Well-connected football executive would support Rodri’s calls for a player strike
arts.sum: Football conversation over the past few weeks has started to be dominated by the notion of a player strike, something that Man City ace, Rodri, brought to national attention in a recent press conference. In the days that followed, players from other high profile clubs across the continent added weight to Rodri’s comments, and, in […] The post “It’s very close” – Well-connected football executive would support Rodri’s calls for a player strike appeared first on CaughtOffside.
